sentences.sContent: He was the only thing there that seemed decent: and I thought he never looked better.
sentences.sContent_eng: He was the only thing there that seemed decent: and I thought he never looked better.
sentences.sCn: 他是那里唯一的看上去很体面的人；我认为他从来没有这样好看过。

sentences.sContent: A decent argument can almost certainly be made against all of those statements, which is why this award is so close this year, especially between Kobe and Paul.
sentences.sContent_eng: A decent argument can almost certainly be made against all of those statements, which is why this award is so close this year, especially between Kobe and Paul.
sentences.sCn: 一个得体的争论几乎可以明确的作出来对抗所有这些争论，那就是为什么今年这个奖项如此激烈，特别是在科比和保罗之间。

sentences.sContent: ...And graduating doesn’t even provide any guarantee of a decent job: six in ten graduates today are in non-graduate jobs...
...for certificates do play a vital role when students look for a decent job...

exam.question: In some remote places there are still very poor people who can’t afford to live in ______conditions.

answer.explain: 句意： 在一些偏远的地区， 还有十分贫困的人无法在像样的环境下生活。gracious： 亲切的； honorable： 可敬的； positive： 肯定的。

synos.tran: 正派的；得体的；相当好的

remMethod.val: de(离开) ＋ cent(分币) → 离开分币， 不计较钱 → 大方的

words.tran: 合适地；高雅地；正派地；亲切地
正派；体面；庄重；合乎礼仪；礼貌
